instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
Hi, got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with corrosion on <CAPACITOR>C7115</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7116</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R7116</RESISTOR>. Replaced them and also replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> just in case. 

Trace from <CAPACITOR>C7115</CAPACITOR> to <RESISTOR>R7116</RESISTOR> was blown and soldered jumper. Both <CAPACITOR>C7116</CAPACITOR> were also blown, soldered one side to probe point near <RESISTOR>R7116</RESISTOR> and another jumper across the board to pin 1 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>. Continuity from all pins of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> seems to be ok, however, board is destroyed under under  <CAPACITOR>C7116</CAPACITOR> from the corrosion. 

Now the board shows green light and then orange. No fan spin. 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 1.3v, no signs of heat generation. Diode mode on  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 0.116

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
Post <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> basic voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.

Also post diode mode reading at F7140 in reverse way (black probe on ground).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
Pin1: 0v
Pin2: 14.7 v
Pin3: 3.92 v
Pin9: 3.394v
Pin12: 3.394v
Pin13: 3.357
Pin14: 3.359v
Pin15: 0v
Pin17: 1.339
Pin19: 5.04v
Pin20: 5.04v
Pin27: 0v

Resistance pins 17/18: 3.6 ohms
Resistance pins 27/28: 20.01 ohms

reverse Diode mode F7140: 0.0

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
"Pin9: 3.394v
-----
Pin27: 0v
--------
Resistance pins 27/28: 20.01 ohms"
Check these again.
Pin 28 voltage?

Did you measure resistance directly between pins 27/28???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
Sorry:

Pin 9: 0
Pin 27: 14.55
Pin 28: 14.4v
Resistance pins 27/28: 19.8 ohms
Yes, direct resistance

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
"reverse Diode mode F7140: 0.0"
Do you mean OL maybe; you've posted no short before.
PLEASE, post accurate information.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light, no fan spin
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
Then you have more damage caused by corrosion around <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
Check all the traces, solders and adjacent components.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light, no fan spin
threads.message:
I double checked, all solder joints are ok. There's continuity from every single pin of  <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>. All resistors around have correct values. 

The trace that goes from <CAPACITOR>C7102</CAPACITOR> to <CAPACITOR>C7105</CAPACITOR> was corroded and blown but still had continuity. I made a jumper from <CAPACITOR>C7105</CAPACITOR> to <CAPACITOR>C7102</CAPACITOR>  but still same  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  value.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B water damage, green light, no fan spin
threads.message: Change the capacitors; some of them may be damaged by corrosion.
